description: From Latin connectere (“fasten together”), from con- (“together”) +‎ nectere (“bind”).

examples: My connects in Chicago are telling me all kinds of things. Nobody knows anything for sure except that Griffith is missing and money is missing.

verbs.description: connect (third-person singular simple present connects, present participle connecting, simple past and past participle connected)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, of an object) To join (to another object): to attach, or to be intended to attach or capable of attaching, to another object.
examples: Synonyms: affix, join, put together, unite; see also Thesaurus:join
I think this piece connects to that piece over there.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, of two objects) To join: to attach, or to be intended to attach or capable of attaching, to each other.
examples: Both roads have the same name, but they don't connect: they're on opposite sides of the river, and there's no bridge there.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, of a blow) To arrive at an intended target; to land.
examples: When that roundhouse kick connected with his temple it sent him flying across the room.

entries.meaning: (transitive, of an object) To join (two other objects), or to join (one object) to (another object): to be a link between two objects, thereby attaching them to each other.
examples: The new railroad will connect the northern part of the state to the southern part.

entries.meaning: (transitive, of a person) To join (two other objects), or to join (one object) to (another object): to take one object and attach it to another.
examples: I connected the printer to the computer, but I couldn't get it work.

entries.meaning: To join an electrical or telephone line to a circuit or network.
examples: When the technician connects my house, I'll be able to access the internet.

entries.meaning: To associate; to establish a relation between.
examples: I didn't connect my lost jewelry with the news of an area cat burglar until the police contacted me.

entries.meaning: To make a travel connection; to switch from one means of transport to another as part of the same trip.
examples: I'm flying to London where I connect with a flight heading to Hungary.
